questiontext.text:
A teacher is interested in how the number of hours that students have studied (“HOURS”) on the score on a particular test (“SCORE”). He conducts a regression analysis with these two variables, using data from a sample of 160 students.

This leads to the following linear model: SCORE = 2.30 + 0.80 * HOURS.

The teacher wants to determine whether UREN has a positive influence on SCORE. He tests two-way with a 5% significance level (α = 0.05). What should the teacher test in this case?

answer.text: He should check whether the value 0.80 is significantly different from 0.00.
He should check whether the value 0.80 is significantly different from 0.05.
He must verify that the value 0.80 is significantly smaller than 1.96.
He must verify that the value 0.80 is significantly different from 0.025.
He must verify that the value 0.80 is significantly smaller than 0.95.
